revisions.rev:
{{Infobox software | name = LINA | screenshot = | caption = | author = | developer = Lina Software | released = | latest release version = 1.00 beta1 | latest release date = {{release date and age|2009|10|15}} | latest preview version = | latest preview date = | programming language = [[C (programming language)|C]], [[C++]], [[Python (programming language)|Python]] | operating system = [[Microsoft Windows|Windows]], [[Mac OS X]] | platform = | language = | status = discontinued | genre = [[Compatibility layer]] | license = [[GNU General Public License]] v2 | website = formerly, [http://www.openlina.com/ www.openlina.com] }} '''LINA''' was a piece of [[open-source software]] that enabled users to run applications compiled for [[Linux]] under [[Microsoft Windows|Windows]] and [[Mac OS X]] with a native look and feel. Version 1.00 beta1 was released in October 2009 and was available at [http://www.openlina.com/ the Open Lina] web site. However, that domain is now up for sale.
== Release == The latest binary version, still a beta, was released on October 15, 2009. As the tool was open sourced under the terms of the [[GNU General Public License]] v2, its source code had been made available since July 19, 2007.
==See also== {{Portal|Free software}} *[[Compatibility layer]] *[[RUNZ]]
